headline: Classic Dinner Rolls
description: Soft, fluffy dinner rolls are simple to make from scratch and perfect to serve alongside any meal. Brush warm rolls with melted butter before serving.
name: Classic Dinner Rolls
recipeIngredient: 2 cups all-purpose flour, divided, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Combine 3/4 cup flour, sugar, undissolved yeast, and salt in a large bowl.
Heat milk, water, and 2 tablespoons butter in a saucepan until very warm (120 degrees to 130 degrees F).

Add warm milk mixture to the flour mixture. Beat for 2 minutes on medium speed of an electric mixer, scraping the bowl occasionally. Add 1/4 cup flour; beat for 2 minutes at high speed. Stir in enough remaining flour to make soft dough.
Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 8 to 10 minutes. Cover; let rest for 10 minutes.
Shape pieces into balls and place in a greased 8-inch round pan. Cover and let rise in warm, draft-free place until doubled in size, about 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Bake rolls in the preheated oven until golden brown on top, about 20 minutes. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: Rubbed a little butter on top after they were done. Making another batch already lol

I mixed my yeast in with the wet & the sugar, and allowed it to bloom. Greased my baking dish with butter & allowed to rise an extra 10 minutes (than the recipe calls for) before preheating my oven. Baked for 20 minutes with the last 7 covered with foil. We had these warm with grilled steaks, brussel sprouts cooked with bacon, onions & mushrooms, and crispy garlic parm potatoes. They were delicious!

I changed the recipe and they turned out great! Iâ€™m only giving 4 stars because I didnâ€™t exactly use the recipe after reading some comments. I did not add the salt with the yeast because Iâ€™ve always heard that salt kills yeast. So I mixed it into the milk, water mixture. Mixed the dry ingredients and then added in the wet. They turned out delicious and super easy considering the low rise time, 10 mins and then 30 which isnâ€™t bad compared to other recipes. Iâ€™ll definitely be using this recipe from now on.

These came out great! This is the second time I have baked these, and each time has been just wonderful! They fluff up so nicely and bake nice and brown. Oh, and the taste is wonderful! Served hot out of the oven with either bread or honey! Just the best! They were served along side slow cooker beef stew. Great dinner to come home to
Very good!!

I have made these a few times now and they are always perfect. I do use the traditional yeast though (2 1/4 tsp). I warm the milk, butter, sugar and salt until the butter melts and then proof the yeast in 1/4 cup of warm water with about 1/2 tsp. of sugar and then add to the warm milk mixture and then add flour as needed and knead by hand. I let it rise for one hour, form into balls (after weighing them) and let them rise for one more hour. For those that are saying they are getting biscuits or hockey pucks, maybe check that your yeast is not too old?

First time making rolls. I about gave up because i didnt think they were going to rise so I preheated the oven and put the dough on the stove and it did its thing. Followed everything else to a T and they are awesome looking.
Great recipe,, I have made twice. I didnâ€™t have butter second time round so I substituted softened crisco shortening,, was still great!!
They taste great but followed the recipe exactly and they can out heavy just donâ€™t know where I went wrong.
A very simple recipe which produces a very good product. Itâ€™s the sort of bread which can be made on short notice ie 1.5-2.0hours. Whenever Iâ€™ve made it Iâ€™ve had no complaints.
First time making dinner rolls! Consistency between a roll and a biscuit. Nice crunch on the outside and perfectly soft on the inside. Yum!
These turned out to be more biscuits than dinner rolls. The flavor wasn't there either even though I followed the recipe exactly and added butter on top at the end. Will not be making again.
I used a bread machine to make the dough. Came out wonderful. Used buttermilk that was leftover from making butter. Perfect
I use this recipe regularly, and they always turn out amazing!! My family loves them
Perfect! I counted wrong when cutting squares but didn't change the flavor!! Only buttered the tops when they came out of the oven. SOOO GOOD!
I followed direction but used regular yeast and I mixed by hand. These turned out really good! Would have been even better had I remembered to add the butter!

Amazing!! I used heavy cream and almond milk combined in place of the milk. Used a full stick of butter with the end like a paintbrush to slather on butter straight out of the oven. This softened the brown tops and made them SO GOOD. I also doubled the recipe and weight out 3.2 ounce balls of dough that I formed by gathering the edges into a pinched fold underneath, for a smooth round top. They were big! I used bread flour instead of AP. Mixed it up in my kitchenaid but kneaded by hand also until I was satisfied... I also accidently overproofed them for the last rise but they are very forgiving and turned out so well. It's a staple recipe now!

I'm a new baker and was looking for an easy recipe to follow. I just made 2 changes, I use water instead of milk and vegetables oil instead of butter. They came out like the posted picture and delicious.
Super easy! I hand mixed, and kneaded. Turned out GREAT. Light, with just the right amount of flavor. I would definitely recommend this for young adults or beginner cooks.
I made meat pies with this dough they turned our AMAZING!! no more store bought gmo bread in tjis house.

So delicious!!! I use regular dry yeast so I proof my yeast in the water, milk, and sugar for about 10 minutes. Add the melted butter into yeast and then pour into dry ingredients. Then follow the rest of directions.
perfect!

I sifted my flour. I added the liquids and yeast first before then putting it into the 1st portion of flour mixture. Then let the yeast water milk sugar and salt sit for 15 minutes before adding the rest of the flour. Otherwise no changes. Fantastic recipe

Turned out fabulous. You can see in the pic my husband already snatched one. Next time I will try with variations, rosemary or garlic and cheese. Yum. Used the KitchenAid mixer which made kneading super easy. Also, weighed rolls before baking ( approx 1.4 oz each) as one comment suggested.thank you for sharing this recipe

I am new at making bread I have used this recipe for the third time. I like the way it comes out I just need to work on it a little more and get a little more practice. My mother made the best hot rolls in the state and I would love to be able to make them like she did. So with that in mind nothing is going to compare to hers but I'm working on it and one day maybe I'll get there. Great recipe worth making

I did make these and they did rise but I didn't have the soft tops that were shown. I didn't take all the steps needed. I mixed the dough and separated the dough balls immediately. I think I should have kneaded the the dough like it told me but the flavor was right. They did rise they were just hard on the top instead of just right.
these rolls turned out great for us. We did start them in the breadmaker and added the ingredients in the order listed. My husband said they were perfect!
Wonderful! Only issue I had was not enough flour when I mixed it. Easy solution! Used the proofing setting on my stove and they really were great!
instead of milk I used 1/2 buttermilk and 1/2 almond milk.AWESOME!

First time I've successfully made bread that tastes and feels like proper bread. I've had problems with bread not being airy enough before, so I did a 30 minute initial proof and then an hour 2nd proof before cooking to make sure I had enough fluff to the dough. I also brushed some melted butter and sprinkled some salt on top before baking.
This recipe turns out perfect, every single time. One of my familyâ€™s favourites and my go to when making buns to go with a stew or soup!
I have already made this once before, made it again but instead added cheese to the dough and brushed garlic butter over the rolls afterðŸ¤¤so good, would definitely recommend.
Super easy, I made it with kneading by hands and bread maker both - it got fluffier with the machine but either way still delicious!

The recipe was amazing! I did make it a little differently to start. I heated my milk water and butter together to 110 degrees Fahrenheit and added it to the yeast and sugar. let it sit for 5 to 10 minutes and then added that to the flour and salt. Loved!!
My grandma uses this recipe all the time and I decided to give it a try and they turned out amazing!!! They are light and fluffy
Delish! I only had square nonstick pan and made 9 rolls.
Yeast activated beautifully even though not dissolved in warm water first. Used 1\2 bread flour and 1\2 AP. Did have trouble making 12 event sized rolls---more like 8.
Made these with added garlic powder family loved them
Never again. Absolutely the worst recipe I have ever used to make dinner rolls. They did not rise. At all. I followed the recipe exactly. Unedible.

They went over at Christmas dinner wonderfully!! 
Light and delicious.

I've made this recipe four times which resulted in varying level of mediocrity. 

My problem with this recipe is that it calls for all purpose flour, which makes the rolls have a taste and texture that is more similar to biscuits than it is to bread, but not as good. Looking through the photos, you can easily identify those who used bread flour and those who used all purpose flour.

My recommendation is to substitute bread flour for all purpose flour, but if you don't have bread flour, just make biscuits instead. It's much faster and easier and the biscuits will taste much better.
Pillow soft and delicious. Doubles great for garlic rolls

made this recipe today and the only thing i dad different was I proofed my yeast first , they turned out wonderfully this will be my go to recipe from now on !!! 
 E, Conwath
Super easy to make and very tasty! Used dough hook and proofed yeast with water and sugar.

OMG, I have stayed away from the bread part of baking but after coming across this recipe, Iâ€™ll be baking these rolls for the remainder of my life. I followed the exact recipe to a teeâ€¦â€¦

I love these rolls
Looks yummy!

Yummy rolls! I used my hand and a spatula to knead it, since it was pretty sticky (I thought they wouldnâ€™t turn out), but it came together well. Rolls were quite small for a 12 count, so next time Iâ€™ll make them smaller. Although theyâ€™re so delicious Iâ€™ll double the recipe next time!
I subbed in 1/2 cup whole wheat flour and they turned out great. I appreciate the use of rapid rise yeast to allow these to be made in a reasonably quick amount of time.
Loved the recipe. I topped it with garlic butter and it was amazing!
I made the recipe as is but allowed the dough to poof for longer than the recipe said. The dinner rolls came out soft, fluffy, springy, and so buttery delicious.
So soft and not sweet. Made sure liquid was the right temp. Dough rose perfectly. Thank you

I have been baking bread for a while. I have never used rapid rise yeast and based on several reviews, I substituted active dry yeast and followed protocol for that. These didn't turn out at all...... I couldn't get a decent proof out of them and they turned out to be hockey pucks. This recipe seems to work for other folks but I'll stick to recipes that call for the yeast that I use.
These did not raise. I used regular active yeast and after 2 hours did not double in size. Next time I will try adding steam when I proof them
This recipe was very easy to make!
Was really easy and I'm a horrible baker lol

They were pretty easy to make, but didn't look like the photo, perhaps I didn't let the dough rise enough. A little bland, maybe add a some other seasoning to the dough, or just a bit more salt. My first effort with using rapid rise yeast, not sure if that may affect the lack of flavor?

So I made these I thought I followed the recipe and I got to the kneading part and realized I forgot the water, but it was too late ! So I baked them and they turned out wonderful so even with water omitted Iâ€™m they were great!
Wonderful bread. Turns out amazing. Perfect rolls!
Great

I did what the recipe said and they did not rise and did not look like rolls. Iâ€™m going to try this again and do it a little different and see how they turn out. I wish you can put pictures on here to show what it looks like. If it donâ€™t work out again I will find a different recipe
I made this recipe exactly the way it instructed and they came out fabulous! Nice and fluffy, not heavy at all. Even soft the next day! I will definitely make this recipe again!

These were so delicious. Ran out of butter so used margarine then put some more melted margarine along with garlic powder and parm at the end and they turned out amazing for my first time making rolls. My daughter told me I need to make these everyday.

I made as is and was surprised they came out. The 2 cups flour seems like a lot I may have ended up with 1 and 3/4 cups flour. I was actually trying to make rolls to eat with cheese but these were sweeter than I anticipated. They came out beautifully and I know I kneaded for about 6 minutes. I cooked for 18 mins and they were amazing!
Best I have made. They were very good.
I also followed the recipe exact as it was written. My rolls looked nothing like that picture. They were about an inch high. I knew that recipe was too good to be true.
They turned out perfectly! I've only made dinner rolls once before, and they turned out like hockey pucks. These were great â€¦Â I brushed them with melted butter and honey before serving.
It was great!!! I made 2 loaves instead of rolls the Flavor is marvelous next time I'll knead it more and try it as rolls
Perfection, finally. I'm a grill and smoker man and have never bee successful with baking anything but these are going to be a regular feature around here now!

Pretty tasty, light texture and moist crumb. I usually change a few things. First, I use regular yeast, so I warm the water and activate the yeast with the sugar. Let the rolls proof for 45 minutes to 1 hour after dividing. I've found that dividing into 8 rolls makes a nice size and fits really well in my cake tin. My wife really loves it and it gets me off the hook for forgetting chores

This is my go-to roll recipe and I make these rolls all the time, especially with pot roast. I suggest a triple batch was the kids love 'em. Only variation is I proof the yeast a 5 or so minutes before adding the flour (to proof add the milk water and butter to the yeast and whisk it a bit). It should get a little bubbly and have that nice yeasty smell. If not your yeast may be a little old.
Made these for Thanksgiving. They are super easy and really good. I used my KitchenAid stand mixture instead of kneading by hand and they were perfect.

Not only are these yeast rolls easy to make, as homemade rolls go, but they are absolutely DELICIOUS! 

Definitely make sure your milk/water isn't too hot or you'll kill the yeast. What I did was heat on the stove to "scald" the milk and then remove and let sit for several minutes until it just felt warm. That worked perfectly for me. 

I wound up kneading for about 10 minutes to be sure the dough was worked properly. And then I let sit 10 minutes, then hand rolled it to 12" uniform, and cut 12 one-inch pieces, then rolled to let rise and bake. 

I will definitely make these again! Highly recommend giving this recipe a try!

This recipe was very easy to make. Rolls were very soft and fluffy. I proofed active dry yeast as I didn't have rapid rise. I also proofed the dough for an hour in my microwave ( hot water in a pan, with a cooling rack on top and then the bowl of warm dough on top, covered with a towel ) until doubled after kneading it about 10 minutes. I also gently shaped it into a log and then cut with a bench scraper and then into a ball shape and brushed with butter.

To those people who had trouble getting the dough to rise, the recipe was written to produce a warm dough - but it does this by having the water/milk be at 120-130F. This temperature can start to kill the yeast, so be sure to immediately mix everything as soon as the liquid is added; this will minimize the amount of time it's in direct contact with the yeast. Also, be sure to not overheat the fluid, as that will DEFINITELY kill stuff. I was able to make these without too much trouble. fast and easy, although the recipe is slightly "delicate"...
When you put the butter on top of the rolls, add garlic to the mixture, and then it will taste sooo good
This recipe was perfect as is. Classic standard dinner rolls without a ton of fuss!
Stuffed with garlic and cheese, brushed with garlic butter. Perfect.
Perfect as is.

I do this recipe every year for Thanksgiving and Christmas, and a few other times in between. They're fantastic, no tweaks to the recipe necessary. The only reason I don't make them more often is that they are highly addictive! However, there's definitely a bit of technique to it that the recipe doesn't necessarily impart, as I found out one Thanksgiving when I was recovering from surgery and my husband decided to take over baking the rolls. I'm not sure what he did differently (my guess is something to do with the speeds on the stand mixer) but they didn't rise as well for him.
Made the recipe exactly and they did not rise. I never usually have this issue, but this did not work for me at all.
Double the butter
Very easy and delicious!

I did not put any butter on the top, instead I used egg-wash and it looked and tasted great! I recommend to use parchment paper so that the buns don't stick. I used plenty of oil but it stuck. Overall I loved these flavorful, wholesome buns!
I made these dinner rolls for Sunday dinner and they came out perfect!! This is a keeper. I will make this again and again. They were delicious!!

I made these rolls following the receipe given. They turned out so soft, buttery and perfect . I would advise you to double the receipe because 12 is not enough. They are so tasty that you just want to keep eating them. I can't wait make them again.

My daughter made these twice now and they are utterly delicious. There's definitely a sweet hint to them, so we might cut the sugar down a little next time. We had them as dinner rolls, but next time we're going to try them as hamburger buns and see how they hold together.

I have made this 2 times now and it has been a huge success! I put the rolls in the oven at about 100 degrees and turned the oven off as soon as I put the rolls in to let it rest. They rose really well when I did that and it made them nice and fluffy.
My family loves this dinner roll. The only recipe I have been using.
Changed the shape of the rolls because I'm lazy but they turned out amazing! Super quick to make and recipe was easy to follow.
Add more butter, garlic, and herbs!
Easy to make and turned out delicious! I like that it makes a small batch. The measurements and timing was all spot on!
so yummy and easy ! i added flaky salt on top
Easy to make and taste very good

I made them like the suggestion in comments to activate yeast in warm water and sugar. I did heat the butter and milk together. I put flour and salt in bowl and mixed in butter/milk Mixture and then yeast. I blended until the ingredients were melded together and then turned out on to glass non flour surface and hand kneeded for 8 minutes. I let rest for 10 and then formed into balls and let rise for the 30. Popped in oven and they are delicious! Will def do this again!!
It turned out fine. I would let it rise a little more. Taste was great tho.

Turned out very well! They are small portions, which were quite good for sliders. Also very good on their own.

Changes made:
Active dry yeast went into warm milk, butter, and sugar mixture for a few minutes before pouring into flour.

Since we're a little low on AP flour, I used 1 and a quarter cup AP? (So initial mixing instructions and then adding a bit) to make the dough, then switched to whole wheat. They were still very fluffy! When I make it next, I'll likely use more WW flour.

Before baking, added an egg wash for a more golden colour.
I can make these while cooking dinner! Done at the same time. So simple. Anyone that had trouble making the dough rise, needs to review the temps. Yeast is sensitive.
I doubled the recipe. Rolls tasted really good but I couldnâ€™t get them to look anywhere near the photo used.

So easy and tasty. I had to add about 1/2 C of flour after adding the last 1/4 C but in the end it was really good. I was worried about them not rising but because it calls for rapid yeast i guess it rises as it cooks. I allowed the rolls to rise for an hour as opposed to 1/2 hour. Really good!
